title: Web Developer
education: Bachelor's degree or college diploma in computer science or web development.
duties: Write, modify, integrate and test website related code
Conduct tests and perform security and quality controls
Optimize website content and performance

title: UI/UX Designer
education: A university degree or college diploma in graphic design or web design.
duties: Consult with clients to establish the overall look
Develop the graphic elements that meet the clients' objectives
Establish guidelines for layouts and design

title: Software Developer
education: A bachelor's degree in computer science or computer engineering.
duties: Write, modify, integrate and test software code
Maintain existing computer programs
Identify and communicate technical problems

title: Graphic Designer
education: A university degree or college diploma in visual arts or graphic design.
duties: Determine the medium best suited to produce the desired visual effect
Prepare sketches, layouts and graphic elements
Use existing photo and illustration banks and typography guides

title: Administrative Assistant
education: Completion of secondary school is usually required. A one- or two-year college or other program for administrative assistants.
duties: Prepare, key in, edit and proofread correspondence
Open and distribute incoming regular and electronic mail
Schedule and confirm appointments

title: Baker
education: Completion of secondary school. Completion of a three- or four-year apprenticeship program for bakers.
duties: Prepare dough for pies, bread, rolls and sweet goods
Bake mixed dough and batters
Frost and decorate cakes and other baked goods

title: Airport Operations Specialist
education: A college diploma in aviation management or airport operations.
duties: Coordinate activities of ground crews
Ensure safety regulations are followed
Monitor airport facilities

title: Financial Accountant
education: A university degree and a professional training program approved by a provincial institute of chartered accountants.
duties: Plan, set up and administer accounting systems
Prepare financial information for individuals
Analyze financial documents and reports

title: Human Resources Specialist
education: A university degree or college diploma in human resources management.
duties: Plan, develop, implement and evaluate human resources policies
Advise managers and employees on the interpretation of personnel policies
Negotiate collective agreements

title: Journalist
education: A university degree or college diploma in journalism or a related field.
duties: Collect information through interview, investigation and observation
Write news stories for publication or broadcast
Receive, analyze and verify news and other copy

title: Chef
education: Completion of secondary school. Cook's trade certification.
duties: Plan menus and ensure food meets quality standards
Supervise cooks and other kitchen staff
Estimate food requirements and food and labour costs

title: Medical Laboratory Assistant
education: Completion of a college certificate program in medical laboratory science.
duties: Collect blood or other samples from patients
Log patient samples and prepare them for testing
Set up medical laboratory equipment

title: Architectural Technologist
education: Completion of a two- to three-year college program in architectural technology.
duties: Assist in the development of architectural designs
Analyze building codes, by-laws, space requirements and other technical documents
Prepare drawings, specifications and cost estimates

title: Information Systems Analyst
education: A bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.
duties: Confer with clients to identify and document requirements
Conduct business and technical studies
Design, develop and implement information systems business solutions

title: Network Administrator
education: A college diploma or university degree in computer science or network administration.
duties: Maintain, troubleshoot and administer the use of local area networks (LANs)
Evaluate and install computer hardware
Provide problem-solving services to network users

title: Marketing Manager
education: A university degree or college diploma in business administration or a related field.
duties: Plan, direct and evaluate the activities of firms and departments
Establish distribution networks for products and services
Direct and evaluate the marketing strategies of establishments

title: Financial Planner
education: A bachelor's degree in business administration, commerce, economics or a related field.
duties: Develop financial plans for clients
Analyze clients' financial records
Advise clients on investment strategies

title: Electrical Engineer
education: A bachelor's degree in electrical engineering.
duties: Conduct research into the feasibility, design, operation and performance of electrical generation and distribution networks
Prepare material cost and timing estimates
Design electrical and electronic circuits

title: Registered Nurse
education: Completion of a university, college or other approved registered nursing program.
duties: Assess patients to identify appropriate nursing interventions
Collaborate with members of an interdisciplinary health team
Administer medications and treatments

title: Civil Engineer
education: A bachelor's degree in civil engineering.
duties: Confer with clients and other members of the engineering team
Conduct research and determine construction specifications
Plan and design major civil projects

title: Building Science Engineer
education: A master's degree in building science or related engineering field.
duties: Analyze building envelope performance
Design energy-efficient building systems
Conduct field reviews and testing

title: Hotel Manager
education: A university degree or college diploma in hotel management.
duties: Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the operations of a hotel
Recruit and supervise staff
Set room rates and allocate funds

title: Bookkeeper
education: Completion of secondary school. Completion of a college program in accounting, bookkeeping or a related field.
duties: Keep financial records and establish, maintain and balance various accounts
Post journal entries
Prepare trial balances of books

title: Flight Dispatcher
education: Completion of secondary school. A college diploma in aviation or related field.
duties: Authorize the departure of aircraft
Prepare flight plans
Monitor flight progress

title: Health Information Management Practitioner
education: A college diploma in health information management.
duties: Classify and code diseases
Collect and analyze health data
Manage health information systems

title: Database Analyst
education: A bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.
duties: Collect and document user requirements
Design and develop database architecture
Design, construct, modify, integrate and test data models

title: Digital Marketer
education: A university degree or college diploma in marketing or communications.
duties: Develop and implement digital marketing strategies
Manage social media accounts
Analyze marketing campaign performance

title: Project Manager
education: A university degree or college diploma. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is often required.
duties: Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the activities of a project
Develop and implement project plans
Manage project budgets and timelines

title: IT Support Technician
education: College certificate or diploma.
duties: Communicate electronically and in person with computer users
Provide advice and training to users
Maintain troubleshooting logs

title: Event Manager
education: A university degree or college diploma in business, tourism or hospitality.
duties: Plan, organize and coordinate conferences
Meet with trade and professional associations
Coordinate services for events

title: Construction Manager
education: A university degree in civil engineering or a college diploma in construction technology.
duties: Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate construction projects
Prepare and submit construction project budget estimates
Plan and prepare construction schedules and milestones

title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer
education: A college diploma in aircraft maintenance.
duties: Troubleshoot aircraft structural, mechanical or hydraulic systems
Adjust and repair aircraft systems
Inspect and test aircraft systems

title: Ecologist
education: A bachelor's degree in biology, ecology or a related field.
duties: Conduct field research and surveys
Study the effects of human activity on the environment
Prepare reports and management plans

title: Forestry Technologist
education: A college diploma in forestry technology.
duties: Conduct forest inventories and surveys
Assist in planning and supervising forestry operations
Implement silviculture programs
